ygData.subject: Mechwarriors??

  The warm waters of the bay blurred the view. The sleek gray and 
black mech emblazoned with the Wolf Clan crest surfaced. There was 
something wrong, though. The Solitaire had a cyclopean cockpit, where 
this one possessed a wolf head similar to the ceremonial mask worn by 
the Clan's bloodnamed warriors. Another thing about it was the fact 
that it seemed to be swimming out of the sea.
  When Katya finally reached the shore, she looked at herself only to 
find out that she had fused with her mech. The heavy large laser 
normally forming the right arm was now readily standing in her back 
and a right arm similar to a human one took its place. The only thing 
was it was made of the same material as the rest of the mech.

Katya: BY THE BLOOD OF NICHOLAS KERENSKY!!!!!!

She stared at herself in shock, terror and disbelief. She was now the 
swift and dangerous mech she had piloted.

Katya: That can not be! I must be dreaming or dead!

Ragnar: Unfortunately, we are not, Loremaster.

She turned, only to find the huge lumbering Dire Wolf. It move like a 
human, for as much as its unman-like chassis allowed it to. Only when 
the cockpit retracted and revealed a figure, the top becoming a 
breastplate and the arms formed shoulder cannons, allowing more 
man-like limbs to appear did she realize that it was actually Ragnar 
himself!

Katya: Ragnar! What has happened to us? Where is Vlad?

Ragnar: For both questions, I do not know, but for the second, I do 
not care. And before you even suggest otherwise, I think we should 
work together for now. 

She thought for a moment, then looked up at him.

Katya: You are right, Star Colonel. What do you think we should do?

Ragnar etched a half-smile.

Ragnar: I do not know about you, but I still feel cold. I suggest we 
make a fire for now. If there are hostiles or beasts coming at us, 
attracted by the fire, we should be able to take them on.

The woman shivered. Yes, she was cold, as human sensations seemed not 
to have left totally her metallic body. In silence, she went to gather 
some wood. Ragnar salvaged the little debries from the Bloody Fang 
that had made it to the shore. When she returned, she threw the wood 
in one spot and used her heavy small laser to light it up.

Katya: I assume, Ghost Bear, that this is a truce at least between us 
for some times...

Ragnar: If you do not oppose it, neither do I. At least until we are 
picked up. If only we had a mean to know where we are...

They both looked at the sky, not recognizing the constellation for 
they had never come to Terra before this day...
